guicomponents
Class G4P

java.lang.Object
  guicomponents.G4P
All Implemented Interfaces:
processing.core.PConstants
public class G4P
extends java.lang.Object
implements processing.core.PConstants

This class has only static methods. It keeps track of all GComponents created. Its primary role is encapsulated in the draw() method which can override the default Processing drawing mechanism.

Author:
Peter Lager

static void addComponent(GComponent c)
          This should be called by all ctors in GComponent and since all GUI components inherit from GComponent and are required to call a GComponent ctor then all GUI components will automatically be registered in the set.
static void disableAutoDraw()
          Once disabled you need to call G4P.draw() from the draw() method if you wish to see the GUI
static void draw()
          Use G4P.draw() if you want to control when you the GUI is to be drawn

          Is autodraw on
static void messagesEnabled(boolean enable)
          G4P has a range of support messages eg
if you create a GUI component without an event handler or,
a slider where the visible size of the slider is less than the difference between min and max values.

Constructor Detail

G4P

public G4P()
Method Detail

addComponent

public static void addComponent(GComponent c)
This should be called by all ctors in GComponent and since all GUI components inherit from GComponent and are required to call a GComponent ctor then all GUI components will automatically be registered in the set.

Parameters:
c - the component that has been created.

setColorScheme

public static void setColorScheme(processing.core.PApplet theApplet,
                                  int schemeNo)
Set the color scheme to be used by G4P
Only reqd if different from the default blue scheme to be global specify before creating GUI components Available schemes: BLUE_SCHEME, GREEN_SCHEME, RED_SCHEME, PURPLE_SCHEME YELLOW_SCHEME, CYAN_SCHEME, GREY_SCHEME

Parameters:
theApplet -
schemeNo - GCScheme.GREEN_SCHEME

setFont

public static void setFont(processing.core.PApplet theApplet,
                           java.lang.String fontName,
                           int fontSize)
Set the font type and size to be used by G4P
Only reqd if different from the default "Serif" 11
to be global specify before creating GUI components

Parameters:
theApplet -
fontName - name of font
fontSize - font size

draw

public static void draw()
Use G4P.draw() if you want to control when you the GUI is to be drawn

disableAutoDraw

public static void disableAutoDraw()
Once disabled you need to call G4P.draw() from the draw() method if you wish to see the GUI

isAutoDrawOn

public static boolean isAutoDrawOn()
Is autodraw on

messagesEnabled

public static void messagesEnabled(boolean enable)
G4P has a range of support messages eg
if you create a GUI component without an event handler or,
a slider where the visible size of the slider is less than the difference between min and max values. This method allows the user to enable (default) or disable this option. If disable then it should be called before any GUI components are created.

Parameters:
enable -
